text:
Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ,
To those who reside as strangers, scattered throughout Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia, who are chosen
speaker: Narrator

text: according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, by the sanctifying work of the Spirit, to obey Jesus Christ and be sprinkled with His blood: May grace and peace be multiplied to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who according to His great mercy has caused us to be born again to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,
speaker: Narrator

text: to obtain an inheritance which is imperishable, undefiled, and will not fade away, reserved in heaven for you,
speaker: Narrator

text: who are protected by the power of God through faith for a salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this you greatly rejoice, even though now for a little while, if necessary, you have been distressed by various trials,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that the proof of your faith, being more precious than gold which perishes though tested by fire, may be found to result in praise, glory, and honor at the revelation of Jesus Christ;
speaker: Narrator

text: and though you have not seen Him, you love Him, and though you do not see Him now, but believe in Him, you greatly rejoice with joy inexpressible and full of glory,
speaker: Narrator

text: obtaining as the outcome of your faith, the salvation of your souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: As to this salvation, the prophets who prophesied of the grace that would come to you made careful searches and inquiries,
speaker: Narrator

text: seeking to know what person or time the Spirit of Christ within them was indicating as He predicted the sufferings of Christ and the glories to follow.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was revealed to them that they were not serving themselves, but you, in these things which now have been announced to you through those who preached the gospel to you by the Holy Spirit sent from heaven—things into which angels long to look.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, prepare your minds for action, keep sober in spirit, set your hope completely on the grace to be brought to you at the revelation of Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: As obedient children, do not be conformed to the former lusts which were yours in your ignorance,
speaker: Narrator

text: but like the Holy One who called you, be holy yourselves also in all your behavior;
speaker: Narrator

text: because it is written: “You shall be holy, for I am holy.”
speaker: Narrator

text: If you address as Father the One who impartially judges according to each one’s work, conduct yourselves in fear during the time of your stay on earth;
speaker: Narrator

text: knowing that you were not redeemed with perishable things like silver or gold from your futile way of life inherited from your forefathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: but with precious blood, as of a lamb unblemished and spotless, the blood of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He was foreknown before the foundation of the world, but has appeared in these last times for the sake of you
speaker: Narrator

text: who through Him are believers in God, who raised Him from the dead and gave Him glory, so that your faith and hope are in God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since you have purified your souls in obedience to the truth for a sincere love of the brothers and sisters, fervently love one another from the heart,
speaker: Narrator

text: for you have been born again not of seed which is perishable, but imperishable, that is, through the living and enduring word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For,
“All flesh is like grass,
And all its glory is like the flower of grass.
The grass withers,
And the flower falls off,
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the word of the Lord endures forever.”
And this is the word which was preached to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, rid yourselves of all malice and all deceit and hypocrisy and envy and all slander,
speaker: Narrator

text: and like newborn babies, long for the pure milk of the word, so that by it you may grow in respect to salvation,
speaker: Narrator

text: if you have tasted the kindness of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And coming to Him as to a living stone which has been rejected by people, but is choice and precious in the sight of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: you also, as living stones, are being built up as a spiritual house for a holy priesthood, to offer spiritual sacrifices that are acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For this is contained in Scripture:
“Behold, I am laying in Zion a choice stone, a precious cornerstone,
And the one who believes in Him will not be put to shame.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
This precious value, then, is for you who believe; but for unbelievers,
“A stone which the builders rejected,
This became the chief cornerstone,”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: But you are a chosen people, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for God’s own possession, so that you may proclaim the excellencies of Him who has called you out of darkness into His marvelous light;
speaker: Narrator

text: for you once were not a people, but now you are the people of God; you had not received mercy, but now you have received mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beloved, I urge you as foreigners and strangers to abstain from fleshly lusts, which wage war against the soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep your behavior excellent among the Gentiles, so that in the thing in which they slander you as evildoers, they may because of your good deeds, as they observe them, glorify God on the day of visitation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Submit yourselves for the Lord’s sake to every human institution, whether to a king as the one in authority,
speaker: Narrator

text: or to governors as sent by him for the punishment of evildoers and the praise of those who do right.
speaker: Narrator

text: For such is the will of God, that by doing right you silence the ignorance of foolish people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Act as free people, and do not use your freedom as a covering for evil, but use it as bond-servants of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor all people, love the brotherhood, fear God, honor the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Servants, be subject to your masters with all respect, not only to those who are good and gentle, but also to those who are harsh.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this finds favor, if for the sake of conscience toward God a person endures grief when suffering unjustly.
speaker: Narrator

text: For what credit is there if, when you sin and are harshly treated, you endure it with patience? But if when you do what is right and suffer for it you patiently endure it, this finds favor with God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you have been called for this purpose, because Christ also suffered for you, leaving you an example, so that you would follow in His steps,
speaker: Narrator

text: He who committed no sin, nor was any deceit found in His mouth;
speaker: Narrator

text: and while being abusively insulted, He did not insult in return; while suffering, He did not threaten, but kept entrusting Himself to Him who judges righteously;
speaker: Narrator

text: and He Himself brought our sins in His body up on the cross, so that we might die to sin and live for righteousness; by His wounds you were healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you were continually straying like sheep, but now you have returned to the Shepherd and Guardian of your souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way, you wives, be subject to your own husbands so that even if any of them are disobedient to the word, they may be won over without a word by the behavior of their wives,
speaker: Narrator

text: as they observe your pure and respectful behavior.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your adornment must not be merely the external—braiding the hair, wearing gold jewelry, or putting on apparel;
speaker: Narrator

text: but it should be the hidden person of the heart, with the imperishable quality of a gentle and quiet spirit, which is precious in the sight of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in this way the holy women of former times, who hoped in God, also used to adorn themselves, being subject to their own husbands,
speaker: Narrator

text: just as Sarah obeyed Abraham, calling him lord; and you have proved to be her children if you do what is right without being frightened by any fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: You husbands in the same way, live with your wives in an understanding way, as with someone weaker, since she is a woman; and show her honor as a fellow heir of the grace of life, so that your prayers will not be hindered.
speaker: Narrator

text: To sum up, all of you be harmonious, sympathetic, loving, compassionate, and humble;
speaker: Narrator

text: not returning evil for evil or insult for insult, but giving a blessing instead; for you were called for the very purpose that you would inherit a blessing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For,
“The one who desires life, to love and see good days,
Must keep his tongue from evil and his lips from speaking deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He must turn away from evil and do good;
He must seek peace and pursue it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the eyes of the Lord are toward the righteous,
And His ears attend to their prayer,
But the face of the Lord is against evildoers.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And who is there to harm you if you prove zealous for what is good?
speaker: Narrator

text: But even if you should suffer for the sake of righteousness, you are blessed. And do not fear their intimidation, and do not be in dread,
speaker: Narrator

text: but sanctify Christ as Lord in your hearts, always being ready to make a defense to everyone who asks you to give an account for the hope that is in you, but with gentleness and respect;
speaker: Narrator

text: and keep a good conscience so that in the thing in which you are slandered, those who disparage your good behavior in Christ will be put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is better, if God should will it so, that you suffer for doing what is right rather than for doing what is wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Christ also suffered for sins once for all time, the just for the unjust, so that He might bring us to God, having been put to death in the flesh, but made alive in the spirit;
speaker: Narrator

text: in which He also went and made proclamation to the spirits in prison,
speaker: Narrator

text: who once were disobedient when the patience of God kept waiting in the days of Noah, during the construction of the ark, in which a few, that is, eight persons, were brought safely through the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Corresponding to that, baptism now saves you—not the removal of dirt from the flesh, but an appeal to God for a good conscience—through the resurrection of Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: who is at the right hand of God, having gone into heaven, after angels and authorities and powers had been subjected to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, since Christ has suffered in the flesh, arm yourselves also with the same purpose, because the one who has suffered in the flesh has ceased from sin,
speaker: Narrator

text: so as to live the rest of the time in the flesh no longer for human lusts, but for the will of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the time already past is sufficient for you to have carried out the desire of the Gentiles, having pursued a course of indecent behavior, lusts, drunkenness, carousing, drinking parties, and wanton idolatries.
speaker: Narrator

text: In all this, they are surprised that you do not run with them in the same excesses of debauchery, and they slander you;
speaker: Narrator

text: but they will give an account to Him who is ready to judge the living and the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the gospel has for this purpose been preached even to those who are dead, that though they are judged in the flesh as people, they may live in the spirit according to the will of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The end of all things is near; therefore, be of sound judgment and sober spirit for the purpose of prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Above all, keep fervent in your love for one another, because love covers a multitude of sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be hospitable to one another without complaint.
speaker: Narrator

text: As each one has received a special gift, employ it in serving one another as good stewards of the multifaceted grace of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever speaks is to do so as one who is speaking actual words of God; whoever serves is to do so as one who is serving by the strength which God supplies; so that in all things God may be glorified through Jesus Christ, to whom belongs the glory and dominion forever and ever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beloved, do not be surprised at the fiery ordeal among you, which comes upon you for your testing, as though something strange were happening to you;
speaker: Narrator

text: but to the degree that you share the sufferings of Christ, keep on rejoicing, so that at the revelation of His glory you may also rejoice and be overjoyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you are insulted for the name of Christ, you are blessed, because the Spirit of glory, and of God, rests upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make sure that none of you suffers as a murderer, or thief, or evildoer, or a troublesome meddler;
speaker: Narrator

text: but if anyone suffers as a Christian, he is not to be ashamed, but is to glorify God in this name.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is time for judgment to begin with the household of God; and if it begins with us first, what will be the outcome for those who do not obey the gospel of God?
speaker: Narrator

text: And if it is with difficulty that the righteous is saved, what will become of the godless man and the sinner?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, those also who suffer according to the will of God are to entrust their souls to a faithful Creator in doing what is right.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, I urge elders among you, as your fellow elder and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, and one who is also a fellow partaker of the glory that is to be revealed:
speaker: Narrator

text: shepherd the flock of God among you, exercising oversight, not under compulsion but voluntarily, according to the will of God; and not with greed but with eagerness;
speaker: Narrator

text: nor yet as domineering over those assigned to your care, but by proving to be examples to the flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Chief Shepherd appears, you will receive the unfading crown of glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: You younger men, likewise, be subject to your elders; and all of you, clothe yourselves with humility toward one another, because God is opposed to the proud, but He gives grace to the humble.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore humble yourselves under the mighty hand of God, so that He may exalt you at the proper time,
speaker: Narrator

text: having cast all your anxiety on Him, because He cares about you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be of sober spirit, be on the alert. Your adversary, the devil, prowls around like a roaring lion, seeking someone to devour.
speaker: Narrator

text: So resist him, firm in your faith, knowing that the same experiences of suffering are being accomplished by your brothers and sisters who are in the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: After you have suffered for a little while, the God of all grace, who called you to His eternal glory in Christ, will Himself perfect, confirm, strengthen, and establish you.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Him be dominion forever and ever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Through Silvanus, our faithful brother (for so I regard him), I have written to you briefly, exhorting and testifying that this is the true grace of God. Stand firm in it!
speaker: Narrator

text: She who is in Babylon, chosen together with you, sends you greetings, and so does my son, Mark.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Greet one another with a kiss of love.
Peace be to you all who are in Christ.
speaker: Narrator
